name: New York
standardBusinessHours: Generally 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM or 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday. However, hours can be longer in demanding industries like finance and law.
majorPublicHolidays: Martin Luther King Jr. Day (3rd Mon in Jan)
businessEtiquette: Punctuality is crucial. A firm handshake and direct eye contact are standard greetings. Business attire is typically formal (suits), especially in finance and law, though tech and creative industries can be more casual. Get straight to the point in discussions. Networking is highly valued.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Mid-morning (10:00 AM - 12:00 PM) or mid-afternoon (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM). Business lunches are common for building relationships.
localLifestyle: Extremely fast-paced, diverse, and competitive. A 24/7 city with endless options for dining, entertainment, and culture. Strong emphasis on ambition and achievement.
localCulture: A melting pot of cultures from around the world. Individualism is generally valued. Communication is often direct and explicit. New Yorkers are known for their energy and resilience.
signatureDish: New York-style Pizza, Bagels with Lox and Cream Cheese, Cheesecake, Pastrami on Rye
businessHub: A global center for finance (Wall Street), media, advertising, fashion, art, and technology. Major industries also include healthcare, real estate, and tourism. Midtown Manhattan and Lower Manhattan are key business districts.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Wall Street & Financial District
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: The historic heart of American finance. Iconic landmarks and major financial institutions. Good for understanding the city's economic pulse.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Times Square & Theater District
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: Iconic hub of entertainment, advertising, and Broadway shows. Can be a vibrant place for client entertainment or after-work activities.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: World-renowned museum with an extensive collection of modern and contemporary art. Excellent for cultural outings or inspiring creativity.

networkingEvents.name: Tech Meetups (e.g., NY Tech Meetup)
networkingEvents.description: Numerous tech-focused meetups covering various specializations, from AI to fintech. Great for connecting with the local tech scene.

networkingEvents.name: Industry Conferences (Finance, Media, etc.)
networkingEvents.description: NYC hosts countless major industry conferences and trade shows. Check event calendars for specific sectors.

businessTip: Networking is key; always have business cards ready. Follow up promptly after meetings. Be prepared for a direct and fast-paced communication style. Understanding current events and industry trends is beneficial.

name: Seoul
standardBusinessHours: Typically 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday. Some companies may have longer hours.
businessEtiquette: Formal attire is generally expected for initial meetings. Bowing is a common greeting, though handshakes are also acceptable, especially with foreigners. Exchanging business cards (myeongham) is crucial; receive with two hands or the right hand and take time to read it. Punctuality is highly valued. Addressing someone by their title and last name is important until a closer relationship is formed.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Mid-morning (10:00 AM - 11:30 AM) or mid-afternoon (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM) are generally good. Avoid lunchtime (12:00 PM - 1:00 PM).
localLifestyle: Fast-paced, dynamic, and highly connected. Strong emphasis on education and technology. Growing interest in work-life balance, though a strong work ethic prevails. Efficient public transportation is a key feature.
localCulture: Collectivist culture valuing group harmony and respect for hierarchy and elders. Politeness and indirect communication are common. 'Nunchi' (눈치), the ability to gauge others' moods and thoughts, is an important social skill.
signatureDish: Kimchi, Bibimbap, Bulgogi, Galbi, Tteokbokki
businessHub: Seoul is a major business hub in East Asia, particularly strong in technology (Samsung, LG), automotive (Hyundai-Kia), manufacturing, and finance. Key business districts include Gangnam (Teheran Valley for IT), Yeouido (financial district), and Gwanghwamun/Jongno (traditional business center).

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: COEX Convention & Exhibition Center
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: Major venue for international conferences, exhibitions, and events. Offers excellent networking opportunities and is connected to a large shopping mall and aquarium.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Dongdaemun Design Plaza (DDP)
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: An architectural landmark designed by Zaha Hadid, hosting various design-related events, fashion shows, conferences, and exhibitions. A hub for creative industries.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Gyeongbokgung Palace
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: The largest of the Five Grand Palaces built during the Joseon Dynasty. Offers a glimpse into Korea's rich history and culture. Suitable for hosting VIPs or for a cultural break.

networkingEvents.name: Seoul Startup Meetup (General)
networkingEvents.date: Often monthly (check specific event platforms like Meetup.com or Eventbrite)
networkingEvents.description: Regular gatherings for entrepreneurs, investors, and tech enthusiasts. Various specific-interest startup groups also exist.

networkingEvents.name: Industry-Specific Conferences & Trade Shows
networkingEvents.date: Varies throughout the year (e.g., KES - Korea Electronics Show, Bio Korea)
networkingEvents.description: Numerous large-scale forums and exhibitions focusing on specific industries like IT, biotech, manufacturing, etc. Check COEX or KINTEX schedules.

businessTip: Building personal relationships (인맥 - inmaek) is important for long-term business success. After-work dinners or social gatherings can be part of this. Be prepared for a technologically advanced environment. Learning a few basic Korean phrases will be appreciated.

name: London
standardBusinessHours: Typically 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM or 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday.
majorPublicHolidays: Early May Bank Holiday (1st Mon in May)
Spring Bank Holiday (Last Mon in May)
Summer Bank Holiday (Last Mon in Aug)
businessEtiquette: Punctuality is very important. A polite handshake is the common greeting. Business attire is generally formal (suits), though it can vary by industry (tech is often more casual). Politeness and a degree of formality are appreciated. Small talk before getting down to business is common.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Mid-morning (10:00 AM - 12:00 PM) or after lunch (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM). Business lunches are common, and after-work drinks ('going for a pint') can be a way to build rapport.
localLifestyle: Cosmopolitan and diverse, with a rich history and vibrant cultural scene. Work-life balance is increasingly valued. Efficient public transport (the Tube, buses).
localCulture: A blend of traditional and modern. Known for politeness, a sense of fair play, and a dry sense of humor. Queuing is an important social custom. Strong pub culture.
signatureDish: Fish and Chips, Sunday Roast, Full English Breakfast, Afternoon Tea
businessHub: A leading global financial center (The City of London, Canary Wharf). Also strong in professional services, technology (Tech City/Silicon Roundabout), media, tourism, and creative industries.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: The City of London (Square Mile)
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: The historic financial district, home to the Bank of England, Lloyd's of London, and numerous financial institutions.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Canary Wharf
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A major business district with many of Europe's tallest buildings, primarily housing banking and financial services firms.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: British Museum
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A world-renowned museum of human history, art, and culture. An excellent option for a cultural break or entertaining clients.

networkingEvents.name: London Tech Week
networkingEvents.description: A major festival of technology and innovation, attracting a global audience.

networkingEvents.name: Industry-Specific Seminars and Networking Groups
networkingEvents.date: Frequent (check platforms like Eventbrite, Meetup.com, LinkedIn Groups)
networkingEvents.description: Numerous events catering to specific professional interests, from finance to marketing and beyond.

businessTip: Understanding British politeness and indirect communication can be helpful. Building rapport is important. Be mindful of titles (e.g., Sir, Dame, Dr.) if applicable. A good understanding of current affairs is often appreciated in conversation.

name: Sao Paulo
standardBusinessHours: Typically 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday, with a 1-2 hour lunch break.
businessEtiquette: Punctuality is valued, though slight delays may be tolerated. A firm handshake and direct eye contact are common greetings. Business attire is formal (suits), though creative industries may be more relaxed. Building personal relationships is key; small talk is common. Portuguese is the primary business language.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Mid-morning (10:00 AM - 12:00 PM) or mid-afternoon (2:00 PM - 5:00 PM). Avoid scheduling during lunch (12:00 PM - 2:00 PM).
localLifestyle: Vibrant, fast-paced, and cosmopolitan. Strong emphasis on social life, music, and food. Traffic can be heavy, so public transport (metro) is widely used. Work-life balance is valued.
localCulture: Warm, expressive, and diverse, with influences from Indigenous, African, and European roots. Brazilians value personal connections and are generally open and friendly. Indirect communication may be used to maintain harmony.
signatureDish: Feijoada, Pão de Queijo, Brigadeiro, Moqueca
businessHub: The economic powerhouse of Brazil, leading in finance, manufacturing, technology, and commerce. Key business districts include Avenida Paulista and Faria Lima.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Avenida Paulista
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: The financial and cultural heart of Sao Paulo, lined with corporate offices, museums, and event spaces. Ideal for business meetings and networking.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: MASP (Sao Paulo Museum of Art)
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A renowned art museum with a significant collection of Brazilian and international works. Great for client entertainment or cultural breaks.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Ibirapuera Park
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A large urban park hosting events, exhibitions, and cultural activities. Suitable for informal meetings or relaxation.

networkingEvents.name: Sao Paulo Startup Meetups
networkingEvents.date: Regularly (check platforms like Meetup.com or Eventbrite)
networkingEvents.description: Events for entrepreneurs, tech professionals, and investors to connect and share ideas.

networkingEvents.name: Industry Trade Shows (e.g., FISPAL, Futurecom)
networkingEvents.description: Major exhibitions for food, technology, and other industries, offering networking opportunities.

businessTip: Invest time in building relationships; Brazilians value trust and personal connections. Learning basic Portuguese phrases will be appreciated. Be prepared for a warm and expressive communication style.

name: Cairo
standardBusinessHours: Typically 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Sunday to Thursday. Some businesses close for midday prayers.
businessEtiquette: Punctuality is appreciated, though flexibility exists. Handshakes are common; use titles (e.g., Dr., Eng.) until invited to use first names. Business attire is formal (suits). Hospitality is key; meetings may include tea or coffee. Arabic is the primary language, though English is widely used in business.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Morning (9:30 AM - 12:00 PM) or late afternoon (3:00 PM - 5:00 PM). Avoid scheduling during Friday prayers (midday).
localLifestyle: Bustling and vibrant, with a mix of modern and traditional elements. Strong emphasis on family, religion, and community. Traffic is heavy; the metro is a reliable transport option.
localCulture: Warm, hospitable, and community-oriented. Respect for tradition and religion is important. Indirect communication is common to maintain politeness.
signatureDish: Koshari, Ful Medames, Molokhia, Shawarma
businessHub: A major economic center in the Middle East and Africa, strong in trade, tourism, manufacturing, and media. Key business districts include Downtown Cairo and New Cairo.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Cairo International Conference Centre
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A major venue for conferences, trade shows, and business events, offering networking opportunities.
topAttractionsForProfessionals.proximityToBusinessDistrict: Located in Nasr City, near business areas

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Egyptian Museum
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: Home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts. Ideal for cultural visits or client entertainment.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Khan el-Khalili Bazaar
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A historic market offering a glimpse into Cairo’s vibrant culture. Suitable for informal outings or gifting.

networkingEvents.name: Cairo Business Meetups
networkingEvents.description: Gatherings for professionals in trade, tourism, and tech to network and collaborate.

networkingEvents.name: Industry Exhibitions (e.g., Cairo ICT, Food Africa)
networkingEvents.description: Trade shows focusing on technology, agriculture, and other sectors, ideal for B2B connections.

businessTip: Show respect for local customs, such as accepting hospitality (e.g., tea/coffee). Building trust is crucial; take time to establish relationships. Basic Arabic greetings will be well-received.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Auckland Sky Tower
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: The tallest structure in the Southern Hemisphere, offering panoramic views and event spaces. Ideal for client entertainment.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Auckland Art Gallery
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A cultural landmark showcasing New Zealand and international art. Great for cultural outings or creative inspiration.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Viaduct Harbour
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A vibrant waterfront area with restaurants and event venues. Suitable for business dinners or informal meetings.

networkingEvents.description: Events for professionals in tech, finance, and creative industries to connect.
